title: 93/324/EEC: Council Decision of 10 May 1993 concerning the extension of the benefit of the provisions of Directive 90/531/EEC in respect of the United States of America
header:
COUNCIL DECISION of 10 May 1993 concerning the extension of the benefit of the provisions of Directive 90/531/EEC in respect of the United States of America
THE COUNCIL OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body: The benefit of the provisions of Directive 90/531/EEC is hereby extended to tenders comprising products originating in the United States of America made for the award of a supply contract by contracting entities listed in Annex 3 to the  Agreement in the form of a Memorandum of Understanding between the European Economic Community and the United States of America on government procurement.
This Decision shall take effect upon entry into force of the Agreement.
This Decision shall cease to have effect on the expiry date of the Agreeement.
This Decision is addressed to the Member States.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 10 May 1993.
For the Council The President N. HELVEG PETERSEN
(1) OJ No L 297, 29. 10. 1990, p. 1.
